INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206-1 Staff qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the
ability, experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff at program have driven youth around while under the influence of
alcohol.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 29, 2022.
Complainant stated Staff 1 was driving Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
and one of the youths took a video of Staff 1 because it was believed
he may have been under the influence.
4

Associate Director (AD) was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on
November 30, 2022. AD stated there are several videos from youth
regarding concerns of Staff 1. There are a few videos that were taken
while the youth were in the vehicle with Staff 1. AD stated those do not
show anything concerning. There is a video from the agency camera in
the IL home that appears to show Staff 1 stumbling. Staff 1 was
confronted about the appearance he was stumbling, and Staff 1
reported that it was related to grief as he had a personal phone call
regarding a death in his family. AD stated there was an internal human
resource investigation to review the concerns regarding Staff 1,
however they were not able to substantiate.
Youth A was interviewed with the assistance of an interpreter via
Microsoft Teams on December 13, 2022. Youth A stated he has never
observed any concerning behavior regarding Staff 1 but has heard from
others in the house that Staff 1 was behaving in a strange manner at
one point, but he did not have any details.
Youth B was interviewed with the assistance of an interpreter via
Microsoft Teams on December 13, 2022. Youth B stated that Staff 1
was not intoxicated while transporting him and other youth. He stated
he asked Staff 1 to wait for him while he grabbed his wallet and was not
willing to wait and left without him. He stated there have been concerns
in the past regarding Staff 1 being under the influence while he is
working. There were 2 occasions when Staff 1 was observed to be
acting as though he was intoxicated. He stated he did not smell alcohol,
but Staff 1 was acting in a strange manner. He does not recall when the
first incident was, but the most recent incident was Saturday, December
10, 2022. Youth B stated that he reported the most recent incident to
another staff member.
Youth C was interviewed with the assistance of an interpreter via
telephone on December 21, 2022. Youth C stated approximately two
months ago Staff 1 drove him and other youth home. The following
morning other youth told Youth C that Staff 1 appeared to be
intoxicated but Youth C did not witness that himself. Youth C stated he
has never noticed Staff 1 to behave in a strange manner and he has
never noticed any physical signs of intoxication regarding Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on January 6, 2023. Staff 1
stated that he has never reported to work under the influence of alcohol
or drugs. He was asked about the surveillance video where he appears
to lose his balance and he stated he had just received news that a
close relative in Africa had passed away.
Video reviewed:
4

Undated video footage from back seat of vehicle was reviewed
on December 1, 2022.
Four separate videos ranging in length from 20 seconds to 1 minute
10 seconds were reviewed. The videos depict a conversation where
one individual is upset with the driver of the vehicle for not picking
them up in a timely manner.
Undated video footage from inside of independent living house
was reviewed on December 19, 2022.
Two separate videos show Staff 1 walk up to a refrigerator and take
something to eat. There are four points in the video where Staff 1
appears to struggle maintaining his balance.
Documents reviewed:
 Personnel file for Staff 1. A performance coaching form was
completed on 10/24/2022 due to an incident on 10/1/2022. Staff
1 was placed on administrative leave pending an investigation
that he was driving under the influence with two youth in the car
after he hit a construction cone and failed to report the incident.
During the course of the investigation, it was discovered that
Staff 1 consumed food that was purchased and owned by youth
of the independent living house. This action was verified to be
true based on video surveillance footage. Staff 1 was issued a
final written warning and required to complete “Driving
Defensively” training in Cornerstone.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is insufficient evidence to
support the allegation.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the agency establish or update current procedure to
follow up on concerns regarding staff person. For example, random
check-in by supervisor, random review of surveillance video, and
protocol for sending staff person for immediate drug/alcohol testing if
displaying concerning or unusual behaviors or concerns are reported.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
